title: How to Pray the Chaplet of the Holy Wounds

steps.title: Begin by praying:
steps.content: Begin by praying: "Holy suffering souls, who can obtain so many graces for us, remember me in the midst of your sufferings. I will work unceasingly to obtain for you the joys of Heaven, and I know you will plead for me. Amen."

steps.title: Make the Sign of the Cross
steps.content: Make the Sign of the Cross : "In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen."

steps.title: On the Crucifix pray:
steps.content: On the Crucifix pray: "Jesus, Divine Redeemer, be merciful to us and to the whole world. Amen." [1] X Research source

steps.title: On the first of three beads pray:
steps.content: On the first of three beads pray: "Strong God, Holy God, immortal God, have mercy on us and on the whole world. Amen." [2] X Research source

steps.title: On the second bead pray:
steps.content: On the second bead pray: "Grace and mercy O my Jesus, during present dangers; cover us with thy Precious Blood. Amen."

steps.title: On the third bead pray:
steps.content: On the third bead pray: "Eternal Father, grant us mercy through the Blood of Jesus Christ, Thine only Son; grant us mercy, we beseech thee. Amen."

steps.title: Repeat the following for each large bead and the ten smaller beads that follow it:
steps.content: Repeat the following for each large bead and the ten smaller beads that follow it: [3] X Research source On the large bead pray: "Eternal Father, I offer Thee the wounds of our Lord Jesus Christ to heal those of our souls. Amen." On each of the 10 beads pray: "My Jesus, pardon and mercy through the merits of Thy Holy Wounds. Amen."

steps.title: Offer a concluding prayer, Prayer for Purity, to Saint Joseph:
steps.content: Offer a concluding prayer, Prayer for Purity, to Saint Joseph: "O Guardian of Virgins and holy Father St. Joseph, into whose faithful keeping were entrusted Christ Jesus, Innocence itself, and Mary, Virgin of virgins, I pray and beseech thee by these dear pledges, Jesus and Mary, that, being preserved from all uncleanness, I may with spotless mind, pure heart and chaste body ever serve Jesus and Mary most chastely all the days of my life. Amen. [4] X Research source
